intro: Ferula melitensis, commonly known as the Maltese cow's milk plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its leaves are compound and can be used as a vegetable in some cuisines. Ferula melitensis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
